description._content: Fay Ku's table will feature an army of hollow paper tigers assembled in a grid formation. There will be as many tigers that can fit onto the table. Instead of having the tiger be realistically depicted in terms of its stripes, the paper will be a pattern based on the Chinese seal script ideograph for “tiger.” The effect will fun but at the same time ghostly, poetic. The references are to both the terracotta army of the first Chinese emperor as well as Kobayashi’s 1964 Kwaidon. On Wednesday evening, April 18, 2012, the Brooklyn Museum will host its annual fundraising gala, the Brooklyn Artists Ball. This year’s ball will celebrate women artists and recognize the fifth anniversary of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Guests will dine at table environments created for the occasion by sixteen Brooklyn women artists selected by the Museum’s curators. Each artist will transform a 40-foot-long table into a new work of art that will be on view for one night only. Brooklyn Artists Ball April 18, 2012 www.brooklynmuseum.org/calendar/event/5132
